lexUnit.name: alert.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a state of readiness to act in response to a negative event or situation.

sentence.text: The Marines appeared to be on high alert at sunset Friday .
Israel had been on high alert against attacks during Passover , which ends tonight .
A major Swedish newspaper , Svenska Daghbladet , said Swedish troops stationed at the base were put on standby alert during the mob rampage but were not deployed .
Jordanian security forces were placed on high alert , deploying throughout the capital around hotels , embassies and malls .
Other embassies in Rome were placed on alert after the explosions .
Mumbai was placed on high alert , and residents were told to avoid crowded places .
U. S. officials said they had not increased security at domestic airports , which have been on alert since an attempt to blow up two U. S. -bound cargo planes in October .
After Wednesday 's attack , court proceedings were suspended , the complex evacuated and the nation placed on alert .

The base was on heightened alert for much of the day , with parts of the installation cleared of personnel and military flights in and out employing defensive measures such as use of chaff and flares .
" General quarters " was sounded to put the crew on full battle alert as soon as it was realized that the ship was under attack , he said .
Had the Stark been on alert , its Phalanx defense system might have prevented the tragedy .
Other council members also blamed the national government and made it clear that the province had been on alert since the announcement of Bin Laden 's death .
